dt: {bc}expenditure of physical or mental effort especially when difficult or compulsory

dt.t: was sentenced to six months at hard {wi}labor{/wi}

dt: {bc}the services performed by workers for wages as distinguished from those rendered by entrepreneurs for profits
{bc}human activity that provides the goods or services in an economy
{bc}the physical activities (such as dilation of the cervix and contraction of the uterus) involved in giving birth
{bc}an economic group comprising those who do manual labor or work for wages

dt: {bc}the organizations or officials representing groups of workers

The flood destroyed the {wi}labor{/wi} of years.

pt: {sc}work{/sc} {sc}labor{/sc} {sc}travail{/sc} {sc}toil{/sc} {sc}drudgery{/sc} {sc}grind{/sc} mean activity involving effort or exertion. {sc}work{/sc} may imply activity of body, of mind, of a machine, or of a natural force.
{sc}labor{/sc} applies to physical or intellectual work involving great and often strenuous exertion.

pt.t: farmers demanding fair compensation for their {it}labor{/it}

pt: {sc}travail{/sc} is bookish for labor involving pain or suffering.

pt.t: years of {it}travail{/it} were lost when the house burned
his lot would be years of back-breaking {it}toil{/it}
an editorial job with a good deal of {it}drudgery{/it}

pt: {sc}grind{/sc} implies labor exhausting to mind or body.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}labur{/it}, from Latin {it}labor{/it}; perhaps akin to Latin {it}labare{/it} to totter, {it}labi{/it} to slip {ma}{mat|sleep|}{/ma}
shortdef: expenditure of physical or mental effort especially when difficult or compulsory
the services performed by workers for wages as distinguished from those rendered by entrepreneurs for profits
human activity that provides the goods or services in an economy

dt: {bc}to exert one's powers of body or mind especially with painful or strenuous effort {bc}{sx|work||}
{bc}to suffer from some disadvantage or distress
{bc}to be in the labor of giving birth
{bc}to treat or work out in often {a_link|laborious} detail
{bc}to spend labor on or produce by labor

shortdef: to exert one's powers of body or mind especially with painful or strenuous effort : work
to suffer from some disadvantage or distress

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or constituting a political party held to represent the interests of workers or made up largely of organized labor groups

shortdef: a penal colony where forced labor is performed

dt: {bc}an organization of workers formed for the purpose of advancing its members' interests in respect to wages, benefits, and working conditions
